00022 /*
00023  * FILE CelFileParallelReader.h
00024  */
00025 
00026 #ifndef _CELFILEPARALLELREADER_H
00027 #define _CELFILEPARALLELREADER_H
00028 
00029 #include "broadutil/BroadException.h"
00030 #include "broadutil/CelFileStreamReader.h"
00031 //
00032 #include <cassert>
00033 #include <cstring>
00034 #include <string>
00035 #include <vector>
00036 //
00037 
00038 // Used only to select what an instantiation of CelFileParallelReader will read.
00039 enum ParallelReaderDesiredAttribute {
00040     ParallelReader_Intensity,
00041     ParallelReader_Stdv,
00042     ParallelReader_Pixels,
00043     ParallelReader_Entry
00044 };
00045     
00046 
00047 // Low-memory use tool for iterating through a set of cel files in parallel.
00048 // Instead of reading all files into memory, it uses CelFileStreamReader to
00049 // read through the files as needed.
00050 // This class currently has two limitations:
00051 // * Only supports reading binary cel files;
00052 // * Can process only about 1000 files at a time (OS file handle limitation).
00053 // Both of these limitations could be removed if necessary.
00054 // This class is a template (possibly foolishly) for two reasons:
00055 // 1) in the hope that the switch statement will be optimized out by the compiler
00056 //    because the value being switched on is constant;
00057 // 2) because eventually this class will be changed so that it reads ahead in each
00058 //    file (if there are more input files than available file handles), and it will
00059 //    read ahead only the desired attribute, instead of the entire entry, in order
00060 //    to maximize memory use.
00061 template<class C, ParallelReaderDesiredAttribute ATTRIBUTE>
00062 class CelFileParallelReader
00063 {
00064   public:
00065     CelFileParallelReader(const std::vector<std::string> &filenames)
00066     {
00067         if (filenames.empty()) {
00068             throw BroadException("It doesn't make sense to create a CelFileParallelReader with an empty list of files",
00069                                  __FILE__, __LINE__);
00070         }
00071         m_readers.reserve(filenames.size());
00072         for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator it = filenames.begin();
00073              it != filenames.end(); ++it) {
00074             m_readers.push_back(CelFileStreamReader(*it));
00075         }
00076     }
00077 
00078     // Get the next value (which value to get is determined by the
00079     // way the template is instantiated), from each file, and return
00080     // the values in the arg values, in the same order as the filenames
00081     // passed to the ctor.
00082     // Any previous contents of values vector are discarded.
00083     // Advances each file so that a subsequence call will return the next
00084     // value.
00085     void getNext(std::vector<C> *values)
00086     {
00087         values->clear();
00088         values->resize(m_readers.size());
00089         for (size_t i = 0; i < m_readers.size(); ++i) {
00090             switch (ATTRIBUTE) {
00091             case ParallelReader_Intensity:
00092                 (*values)[i] = m_readers[i].getNextIntensity();
00093                 break;
00094             case ParallelReader_Stdv:
00095                 (*values)[i] = m_readers[i].getNextStdv();
00096                 break;
00097             case ParallelReader_Pixels:
00098                 (*values)[i] = m_readers[i].getNextPixels();
00099                 break;
00100             case ParallelReader_Entry:
00101                 // The reason the cast below is necessary is for the situation
00102                 // in which ATTRIBUTE != ParallelReader_Entry, in which this
00103                 // line will never be executed, but it must be compilable.
00104                 m_readers[i].getNextEntry((affxcel::CELFileEntryType*)&((*values)[i]));
00105                 break;
00106             default:
00107                 assert(false);
00108                 break;
00109             }
00110         }
00111     }
00112 
00113     // Returns the index of the next element to be read from all the cel files.
00114     size_t getNextIndex()
00115     {
00116         return m_readers[0].getNextIndex();
00117     }
00118 
00119     // Returns the file header for the file at the given index
00120     CONSTHACK affxcel::CCELFileHeaderData &getHeader(size_t whichFile) CONSTHACK
00121     {
00122         return m_readers[0].getHeader();
00123     }
00124     
00125   private:
00126     // Disallow copy ctor and assignment of this class
00127     CelFileParallelReader<C, ATTRIBUTE>(const CelFileParallelReader<C, ATTRIBUTE> &);
00128     CelFileParallelReader<C, ATTRIBUTE> &operator=(const CelFileParallelReader<C, ATTRIBUTE> &);
00129 
00130   private:
00131     std::vector<CelFileStreamReader> m_readers;
00132 };
00133 
00134 #endif /* _CELFILEPARALLELREADER_H */
00135
